CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Such high energy alignment would not enable to achieve a large open - circuit voltage and is eventually detrimental to the PCE output of PT - based PSCs such as in P3HT / PCBM systems with PCE ranging from 3 to 4% . 21,22 Geng and co-workers synthesized two PT - based donor materials by incorporating carboxylate side chains and vinylene linkers between thiophene units. The HOMO and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels of the resulting polymers , PBT and PTT , were substantially stabilized when compared to those of the parent P3HT. Such energy level lowering was attributed to the integration of carboxylate and vinylene groups giving rise to a push - pull structural motif , resulting in an enhanced PCE of the PV devices based on them. 21 Over the years , the use of the structural effect to enhance PSC performance has been extensively investigated , particularly the donor - acceptor ( D-A ) strategy , which has been proved to be an effective approach to develop donor polymers with wide absorption , low - lying energy levels , and enhanced electron properties. 23-32 Besides , conjugation expansion on the polymer backbone is an alternative tool to improve the electronic properties of polymers. By replacing a branched 2ethylhexyl side chain with a linear n-octyl group , Zhang and his co-workers synthesized a PTB7-Th derivative namely , PBTT. PV cells based on PBTT : IEICO showed a superior device performance than that of the PTB7-Th - based device with a PCE of 9.5% , a V oc of 0.86 V , a J sc of 17.9 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 61.3% . Such dramatic enhancement in efficiency was attributed to a higher charge mobility and improved morphology of the PBTT : IEICO blend film induced by the less steric hindered linear alkyl side chain. 1 Yang and coworkers used selenophene to replace thiophene π-bridge in the indacenodithiophene (IDT)-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione (BDD)-based copolymer ( PThBDDIDT ) to develop a donor-π-acceptor type copolymer , PSeBDDIDT. The PCE of solar cells based on polymer : PC71BM as an active layer was dramatically increased from 7.04 to 8.65% , respectively. Such improvement could result from stronger intermolecular interactions , expanded absorption range , and better molecular planarity of selenophene contained PSeBDDIDT. 33 Random terpolymers comprised of thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido [ 3,4- g]- thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione , thiophene( T ) , and dithiophene ( 2T ) were synthesized by Yang and co-workers in which the crystallinity of terpolymers could be controlled by varying the compositions of T and 2T. The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% . 34 Fluorination on polymer backbones has also been widely adopted to tune and improve the functional properties of donor polymers such as stabilization of their energy levels and hence positively impacting on PSC performance.

Let's think step by step.

1. P3HT: This is a polymer donor material with a PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency) ranging from 3 to 4%.
2. PBT and PTT: These are two PT-based donor materials synthesized by Geng and co-workers, with PBT and PTT being the names of the specific polymers.
3. PTB7-Th and PBTT: These are polymer donor materials, with PTB7-Th being a branched derivative and PBTT being a linear derivative.
4. IDT-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione (BDD): This is an acceptor material used in a copolymer with IDT and selenophene.
5. PThBDDIDT: This is a donor-π-acceptor type copolymer developed by Yang and coworkers.
6. Terpolymers: These are random polymers comprised of thieno[2′,3′ : 5′,6′]pyrido [ 3,4- g]- thieno[3,2-c]isoquinoline-5,11(4H,10H)-dione, thiophene(T), and dithiophene (2T).
7. PC71BM: This is an acceptor material used as an active layer in solar cells.
8. Polymer: This is a general term used for various donor and acceptor polymers mentioned in the text.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. P3HT
2. PBT
3. PTT
4. PTB7-Th
5. PBTT
6. IDT-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione (BDD)
7. PThBDDIDT
8. Terpolymers (specific compositions not mentioned)

These are the entities in the text that clearly refer to material names.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| P3HT |
| PBT |
| PTT |
| PTB7-Th |
| PBTT |
| IDT-benzo[1,2-c:4,5-c′]dithiophene-4,8-dione (BDD) |
| PThBDDIDT |
| Terpolymers |

These are the entities in the text that clearly refer to material names, presented in a Markdown table format.

By replacing a branched 2ethylhexyl side chain with a linear n-octyl group , Zhang and his co-workers synthesized a PTB7-Th derivative namely , PBTT. PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Such high energy alignment would not enable to achieve a large open - circuit voltage and is eventually detrimental to the PCE output of PT - based PSCs such as in P3HT / PCBM systems with PCE ranging from 3 to 4% . 21,22 Geng and co-workers synthesized two PT - based donor materials by incorporating carboxylate side chains and vinylene linkers between thiophene units. Such energy level lowering was attributed to the integration of carboxylate and vinylene groups giving rise to a push - pull structural motif , resulting in an enhanced PCE of the PV devices based on them. 21 Over the years , the use of the structural effect to enhance PSC performance has been extensively investigated , particularly the donor - acceptor ( D-A ) strategy , which has been proved to be an effective approach to develop donor polymers with wide absorption , low - lying energy levels , and enhanced electron properties. 23-32 Besides , conjugation expansion on the polymer backbone is an alternative tool to improve the electronic properties of polymers. By replacing a branched 2ethylhexyl side chain with a linear n-octyl group , Zhang and his co-workers synthesized a PTB7-Th derivative namely , PBTT. The PSC based on a terpolymer with the optimized T / 2T ratio of 7 : 3 showed a high J sc of 18.3 mA cm^-2 and a FF of 71.2% , thus resulting in an enhanced PCE up to 10.8% . 34 Fluorination on polymer backbones has also been widely adopted to tune and improve the functional properties of donor polymers such as stabilization of their energy levels and hence positively impacting on PSC performance.

Let's think step by step.

1. PCE (Performance efficiency of the organic solar cells) of PT-based PSCs: Ranging from 3 to 4%
2. HOMO (Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital) energy levels of PBT and PTT: Not specified in the text
3. LUMO (Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital) energy levels of PBT and PTT: Not specified in the text
4. Voc (Open-circuit voltage) of PV cells based on PBTT: 0.86 V
5. Jsc (Short-circuit current density) of PV cells based on PBTT: 17.9 mA cm^-2
6. FF (Fill factor) of PV cells based on PBTT: 61.3%
7. Charge mobility of PBTT: Not specified in the text
8. Energy levels of PThBDDIDT: Not specified in the text
9. PCE of solar cells based on PThBDDIDT and PC71BM: 7.04% and 8.65%, respectively
10. Crystallinity of terpolymers: Not specified in the text
11. Jsc of PSC based on a terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio: 18.3 mA cm^-2
12. FF of PSC based on a terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio: 71.2%
13. PCE of PSC based on a terpolymer with optimized T/2T ratio: 10.8%
14. Energy levels of donor polymers: Not specified in the text (but mentioned to be stabilized by incorporating carboxylate and vinylene groups, and by replacing a branched side chain with a linear alkyl side chain or using selenophene instead of thiophene)
15. Energy levels of PC71BM: Not specified in the text
16. Intermolecular interactions of PSeBDDIDT: Not specified in the text
17. Expanded absorption range of PSeBDDIDT: Not specified in the text
18. Better molecular planarity of PSeBDDIDT: Not specified in the text.

Note: The values provided in the text are given in percentages (%), mA cm^-2, and V. No specific units are mentioned for the energy levels (HOMO and LUMO) and charge mobility.
